traversal.name: Insert user-defined constraint to function body
Set unique ids for generic functions
Filtering of unneeded functions for runtime optimization
Do a topological sort of the subtyping hierarchy
Do a depth first walk of the subtyping hierarchy
Classify edges and build cross-edge based reachability information
Build link count matrix and label vertices for reachability analysis
Preprocess subtyping graph for LUB queries
CUDA Expand shared memory boundary load
CUDA Exploiting data reuse with shared memory
CUDA Exploiting data reuse with cuda shared memory
CUDA Infer reusable arrays in withloops
CUDA Sink scalar code into CUDA withloop
CUDA Adjust return ids of single threaded kernel
CUDA Create single threaded CUDA kerenls
Identify function applications with side-effects for the distributed memory backend
Identify sub-allocated arrays for the distributed memory backend
Annoate memory transfers in conditional function
Minimise the number of device-host data transfers
Minimise the number of device-host data transfers in a loop
Minimise the number of device-host data transfers in a cond-fun
Minimise the number of device-host data transfers in code blocks
Minimise the number of device-host data transfers in a Cudast
Minimise host-device data transfers that resulted from EMRL allocation lifting
Insert shape, lower bound and upper bound constant assignments
Insert CUDA memory transfer primitives for withloops
Insert CUDA memory transfer primitives for cudasts
Insert memory transfer primitives for distributed variables
Specialization Oracle for Static Shape Knowledge
Determine and mark candidates for inlining
Tag main function as thread function
Tag functions as thread functions when needed
Identify side effect functions for the distributed memory backend
Eliminate type variables and do some cleanup
Mark local selects for distmem backend
Transform all gt and ge operators to lt and le operators
Index Vector Elimination (Reuse WL-offsets and Scalarize)
Remove Alias Results from Conformity Checks
Reuse With-loop arrays based on polyhedral model

node.name: Icm
node.description: Using TRAVsons, COMPid would be applied to ICM_ARG1.

son.name: Interface
son.description: symbols imported and exported by the module

son.name: Typefamilies
son.description: Specification of type families

son.name: Structs
son.description: structs defined within the module

son.name: Types
son.description: types defined within the module

son.name: ThreadFuns
son.description: Contains thread functions for mutc back-end.

son.name: FunSpecs
son.description: contains the signatures of forced specializations

attribute.name: Headers
attribute.description: Set of header files "<file.h>" used for external declarations

node.name: Tfspec
node.description: Declaration of type families and relations

node.name: Tfedge
node.description: Parents and children of a vertex

node.name: Typedef
node.description: definition of a user defined type

son.name: ERC
son.description: Stores all WL reuse candidate found up to the initial application of a loop function. These ERCs will only be used to supply arguments when the fundef args have been extended.

attribute.name: CudaLinkName
attribute.description: Symbol name of cuda version of this function

attribute.name: SourceName
attribute.description: original name of a function

attribute.name: LoopRecursiveAp
attribute.description: In a LOOPFUN, this is the N_ap that is the recursive call within the LOOPFUN.

attribute.name: Impl
attribute.description: Points to the implementation. In case of a wrapper function this is the only available instance. In case of an objectwrapper this is the wrapped function instance.

attribute.name: SpawnFun
attribute.description: Points to the copy of this function that can be used as target for a spawn operation in the mutc backend.

attribute.name: IcmDefBegin
attribute.description: ICM for the beginning function definitions

attribute.name: IcmDecl
attribute.description: ICM for function decelerations

attribute.name: IcmDefEnd
attribute.description: ICM to mark the end of a function definition

attribute.name: Companion
attribute.description: This link points to the companion function of the current function. In case this is the sequential version (as encoded by ISSTFUN) of the function, the companion will be the parallel version (as encoded by ISMTFUN) and vice versa. The attribute is used in both implementations of MT.

attribute.name: XTCompanion
attribute.description: This link points to the XT companion function of the current function. This is used in the module version of create MT/ST/XT functions (MTSTFMOD).

attribute.name: MTCompanion
attribute.description: This link points to the MT companion function of the current function. This is used in the module version of create MT/ST functions (MTSTFMOD).

attribute.name: AkvId
attribute.description: Identifier for function instances with akv-arguments (used for function naming in renameidentifiers.c)

attribute.name: InlineCounter
attribute.description: Counter for how many times the function has been recursively inlined.

attribute.name: LastChange
attribute.description: This attribute indicates in which iteration round the PV of the function itself was changed the last time during the specialization oracle for static shape knowledge.

attribute.name: LastIterationRound
attribute.description: This attribute indicates in which iteration round this function was the last time "iterated" (fully or partially) during the specialization oracle for static shape knowledge

attribute.name: Depth
attribute.description: Used to count the depth in the static call graph. (see distribute_threads.c)

attribute.name: Height
attribute.description: Used to count the height in the static call graph. (see distribute_threads.c)

attribute.name: Structgetter
attribute.description: If this function is a getter for a struct element, this attribute points to that element.

attribute.name: Structsetter
attribute.description: If this function is a setter for a struct element, this attribute points to that element.

attribute.name: Callfun
attribute.description: This attribute is used by check_lacfuns to determine unique call sites of LaC functions.

attribute.name: SlowClone
attribute.description: This attribute points to the slow clone implementation if this fundef is the fast clone

attribute.name: Livevars
attribute.description: Contains a union of all livevars inside the body

attribute.name: FPFrameName
attribute.description: When this function contains spawn, unique function name is saved here for the name used in the task frame.

attribute.name: withops
attribute.description: Used by mutc backend for lifting desc mallocs up

attribute.name: Callerfundef
attribute.description: For a LACFUN, this attribute points to the N_fundef code of its external caller. Other functions have NULL here. Valid only during EDFA, POGO, and PWLF. Referenced in PHUT, so any PHUT callers must maintain this. It would be nice to have this maintained throughout compilation, but that may not be trivial.

attribute.name: Callap
attribute.description: If this function is a LACFUN, this attribute points to the N_assign node for the N_ap that invokes the LACFUN from outside the LACFUN; else NULL. Valid only during EDFA, POGO, and PWLF. Referenced in PHUT, so any PHUT callers must maintain this. It would be nice to have this maintained throughout compilation, but that may not be trivial.

attribute.name: RtspecId
attribute.description: Used by rtspec to uniquely identify a function

attribute.name: LoopCount
attribute.description: Loop function iteration count, as computed by LUR. If -1, then count is unknown.

flag.name: IsMain
flag.description: This function is the main function of a program.

flag.name: IsExported
flag.description: This function is being exported from the current namespace and will thus be fully visible from outside.

flag.name: IsProvided
flag.description: This function is being provided from the current namespace and will thus be available for use from outside, only.

flag.name: WasImported
flag.description: This function was imported from another namespace. This as well means that it is local now.

flag.name: WasUsed
flag.description: This function was used from another namespace. This as well means that it is not local.

flag.name: IsLocal
flag.description: This function is defined locally in the current namespace. That is, it was defined locally or imported.

flag.name: IsSticky
flag.description: This function should not be removed by DeadFunctionRemoval. This is mainly used by the module system to ensure that for all exported functions code is generated. Furthermore, it is used to ensure that the prelude functions are not removed during compilation.

flag.name: IsSACargConversion
flag.description: This function is a special SACarg conversion function used by the C interface. This tag is mainly used to ensure that these functions do not turn up in the resulting C header file.

flag.name: IsNeeded
flag.description: This flag is used in multiple phases, usually to tag functions that are referenced in some sense. It has always to be reset to FALSE at the end of each phase.

flag.name: IsCondFun
flag.description: This is a lifted conditional. The function is only referenced once from the context the conditional was lifted from.

flag.name: IsLoopFun
flag.description: This function is a functional representation of a do loop; it is only referenced twice: Once from the context the loop was lifted from and once from the inner recursive application.

flag.name: IsObjInitFun
flag.description: This function is a global object initialiser function derived from the objdef expression.

flag.name: IsThreadFun
flag.description: This function is a mutc thread function.

flag.name: IsSpmdfun
flag.description: This function is a lifted region (usually one withloop) from a SPMD-block; it is only called once from within the region it was lifted from. From a backend perspective, the SPMD function is the transition from sequential to parallel execution. It is called while in sequential mode, its body is exectuted in parallel by multiple threads and it syncronizes on the return.

flag.name: IsXtSpmdfun
flag.description: Same as IsSpmdFun, will be TRUE for XT SPMD functions.

flag.name: IsMtfun
flag.description: This is (potentially) a copy of the original function that will be executed in parallel by multiple threads during runtime. Note that all functions called from such a function need to be MT-funs, as well. If the function is only used in parallel context, this may in fact be the original function that has been reused.

flag.name: IsStfun
flag.description: This is (potentially) a copy of the original function that will be executed sequentially by a single thread during runtime. If the function is only used in sequential context, this may in fact be the original function that has been reused.

flag.name: IsXtfun
flag.description: This is (potentially) a copy of the original function that will be executed in a multi-threaded context and might go parallel.

flag.name: IsCudastGlobalfun
flag.description: This is a single threaded cuda global kernel function.

flag.name: IsCudaGlobalfun
flag.description: This is a cuda global kernel function.

flag.name: IsCudaDevicefun
flag.description: This is a cuda device function (called within a global kernel function).

flag.name: IsSpawnFun
flag.description: True if the function is the target of a spawn operation in the mutc backend

flag.name: IsGeneric
flag.description: True if the function definition contains generic arguments.

flag.name: WasInlined
flag.description: True if the function has been automatically inlined, via AINL

flag.name: HasDotArgs
flag.description: True if the function may take an arbitrary number of arguments. E.g., printf

flag.name: HasDotRets
flag.description: True if the function may generate an arbitrary number of results.

flag.name: IsTypeError
flag.description: TRUE if the given function is a bodyless type error and thus has at least one bottom return type

flag.name: IsObjectWrapper
flag.description: TRUE if the given function is a wrapper for an instance whose instance needed to be extended in the current namespace due to added objects.

flag.name: WasOptimized
flag.description: TRUE if function should be accounted for next optimization cycle again

flag.name: WasUpgraded
flag.description: TRUE iff the return type has changed during the last run of type-upgrade

flag.name: FixpointFound
flag.description: TRUE iff the fixpoint of this function has been found in SOSSK.

flag.name: IsStructConstr
flag.description: TRUE iff this function was created by the HS pass as a constructor for structs.

flag.name: IsCudaLacFun
flag.description: TRUE iff this function is a lac fun that can be executed on the CUDA card.

flag.name: IsForLoop
flag.description: TRUE iff this loop function is generated into for loop in the backend.

flag.name: NoInline
flag.description: This function MUST NOT be inlined. This is set from #pragma noinline.

flag.name: NeedsDynamicMemory
flag.description: This functions needs dynamic memory (malloc)

flag.name: ContainsSpawn
flag.description: This function contains a spawn statement

flag.name: IsSlowClone
flag.description: This function is a slow clone

flag.name: DistMemHasSideEffects
flag.description: This function has side effects and may only be executed by the master node when the distributed memory backend is used.

flag.name: Header
flag.description: Indicates whether or not we need to generate a declaration within header.c when linking to an external library.

flag.name: IsEMRLifted
flag.description: TRUE iff this fundef has been affected by the EMRL optimisation.

node.name: Arg
node.description: One formal argument of a defined function definition.

flag.name: IsReference
flag.description: Set to true if the given argument is a reference argument. The flag is reset to false when resolving reference arguments and WasReference is set to true instead. For all other kinds of arguments it is set to false.

flag.name: WasReference
flag.description: Set to true after resolving reference args if the given argument was a reference argument before. Set to false otherwise.

flag.name: IsArtificial
flag.description: Set to true after resolving objects if the given argument was introduced by an object dependency and thus will be removed once the objects are reintroduced in precompile. Set to false otherwise.

flag.name: DistMemIsUniqueLeaf
flag.description: Indicates that this argument is unique and that it is not passed to another function.

flag.name: IsInUse
flag.description: Used to mark unused function arguments in DeadCodeRemoval. Marked arguments are removed in signature simplification.

flag.name: IsDuplicate
flag.description: Used to mark duplicated function arguments in EDFA. Marked arguments are removed by EDFA, but this flag allows us to simplify outer-level calls in a cleaner fashion.

flag.name: IsMtParallelBranch
flag.description: This block contains the parallel branch of a conditional that implements dynamic parallelisation decisions in the MT backend..

flag.name: IsMtSequentialBranch
flag.description: This block contains the sequential branch of a conditional that implements dynamic parallelisation decisions in the MT backend..

node.name: Structelem
node.description: declaration of an element of a struct

flag.name: HasBeenEliminated
flag.description: Used in ArrayElimination to mark vardecs that are not used anymore. These are later freed by DCR

flag.name: IsSticky
flag.description: This vardec should not be removed by DeadFunctionRemoval. This is exclusively used by MT code generation within SPMD functions to ensure that dummy vardecs in intriduced when creating the SPMD functions that only become vital during code generation do not vanish until then.

flag.name: IsNotAllowedToBeMovedUp
flag.description: This flag is used during the "Withloop Lock Optimization" process. It indicates that certain assignments are not allowed to be moved above the global object-lock.

flag.name: IsNotAllowedToBeMovedDown
flag.description: This flag is used during the "Withloop Lock Optimization" process. It indicates that certain assignments are not allowed to be moved below the global object-lock release.

flag.name: HasMoved
flag.description: This flag is used during moving sync statements phase in FP to indicate that a node has been tried to move before.

attribute.name: MatchingSpawnSync
attribute.description: If the node contains a spawned ap or a sync statement, this will point to the matching spawn or sync statement.

attribute.name: Livevars
attribute.description: If the let node is a spawn or sync statement, this attribute will contain a list of all live variables at this point in the code.

attribute.name: SpawnSyncIndex
attribute.description: If the let node is a spawn or sync statement, this attribute indicates the index of that statement

flag.name: IsCudarizable
flag.description: TRUE iff this loop can be executed on the GPU.

flag.name: IsForLoop
flag.description: TRUE iff this do/while loop is generated into for loop in the backend.

son.name: Args
son.description: Argument list for function invocation

son.name: LoopCount
son.description: If AP_FUNDEF is a LOOPFUN, we may be able to deduce the iteration count for the loop. If so, AP_LOOPCOUNT is an N_exprs that is the count; else NULL. The count may be a constant ( e.g., 42), or it may be symbolic ( e.g., UB-LB).

flag.name: IsSpawned
flag.description: This function call should be spawned

flag.name: IsRemote
flag.description: This function call should be spawned on another resource

flag.name: ToSpawn
flag.description: This node calls a function which contains spawns

flag.name: DistMemHasSideEffects
flag.description: This function application has side effects and may only be executed by the master node when the distributed memory backend is used.

node.name: Funcond
node.description: A SaC expression of the form: cond ? truevalue : elsevalue.

node.name: Array
node.description: Constant array of array elements. In early phases, the elements are exprs; after the array flattening phase, the elements may be an arbitrary mixture of N_id nodes and/or scalar constant nodes. The shapes of all elements must match. The shape of the array represented by the N_array is the catenation of the ARRAY_FRAMESHAPE and the shape specified by the ELEMTYPE.

attribute.name: Elemtype
attribute.description: The type of all array elements. The Elemtype may be used to deduce the common shape of those elements.

attribute.name: FrameShape
attribute.description: The frameshape of the array. The frameshape may NOT be an empty vector, with one simple scalar (e.g., N_num) hanging from AELEMS. Simple scalars must be represented directly as themselves, or via an N_id node.

attribute.name: String
attribute.description: In case of constant character arrays defined as strings, this attribute holds the original definition. The definition needs to be safe for printing as a C string, e.g. special characters need to be escaped. TODO: This should be eliminated as soon as possible.

attribute.name: ICMtext
attribute.description: Deprecated. Will be removed as soon as it has been confirmed that this attribute is no longer used.

attribute.name: NT_Tag
attribute.description: Deprecated. Still used in the compiler backend until major redesign of backend node structure.

flag.name: IsSclPrf
flag.description: Set by AL and DL to indicate that the N_id is the result of a primitive dyadic function operating on simple scalars.

attribute.name: String
attribute.description: The value of this string. Note that the string needs to be in an encoding which is safe for printing in C code, e.g. special characters like quotation marks need to be escaped.

attribute.name: Prf
attribute.description: Describes the type of function this node represents. A list of possible values is found in src/libsac2c/tree/prf_info.mac

attribute.name: NoteintersectInsertionCycle
attribute.description: This is used for analysis of AWLF performance. It is initialized to global.cycle_counter when an F_noteintersect is inserted into the AST, and referenced when AWLF actually performs a WL fold. The intent is to see if we should make AWLF give up on a folding attempt after some N iterations.

flag.name: IsNop
flag.description: Some optimization has decided that this N_prf is a no-op. I.e., it can be (carefully) removed from the AST, but is not in a position within the AST traversal to remove it directly. At present, the only case where this happens is in ixxx. CF performs the actual removal, typically on a traversal after the one that has set this flag.

flag.name: IsFoldNow
flag.description: Set to true by CUBSL if this sel is in a consumer-WL and has been determined to be foldable by AWLF.

flag.name: DistmemIsLocalRead
flag.description: Set to TRUE by DMMLS/IVESPLIT if the distributed memory backend is used, Prf is F_sel_VxA/F_idx_sel and the read is known to be local, even if the array is distributed.

attribute.name: Indent_Before
attribute.description: the default value has to be fixed!

attribute.name: Indent_After
attribute.description: the default value has to be fixed!

attribute.name: CudaLinkName
attribute.description: Declaration of cuda version of an external function

attribute.name: Header
attribute.description: Declare that we wish to use an external declaration/header file instead.

son.name: Dim
son.description: An N_num or N_id specifying the array's rank as a symbolic array attribute. The expression is a numeric constant (N_num) for AKS, AKD, and AKV arrays, and an identifier (N_id) for AUD arrays.

son.name: Shape
son.description: An N_array or N_id specifying the array's shape as a symbolic array attribute. The array is comprised of integer constants (N_num) for AKV and AKS arrays, a mixed array of integer constants and identifiers (N_num, N_id) for AKD arrays with partial shape information, or an identifier (N_id) for AUD and some AKD arrays.

son.name: Min
son.description: This field is an N_id for the minimum value that this variable can have. The field is valid only for integer-like types, i.e., it does not apply to doubles, etc. For example, the Min of the lower bound of a WL index vector might be an N_id pointing to an N_array with value [0,0,0],

son.name: Max
son.description: See AVIS_MIN description; MAX points to the avis of the maximum, rather than the minimum, value of a WL index vector. However, like WL index vectors, MAX is part of a semi-closed interval; MAX(X) is at least 1+maxreduce(X), much the same as GENERATOR_BOUND2 in a with-loop.

son.name: Scalars
son.description: For small arrays, such as shape vectors and index vectors, this field comprises the scalars constituting those arrays as an N_array. This allows us to manipulate the scalars in optimizations such as AWLF, and avoids the need to build an N_array within LACFUNs.

attribute.name: Decl
attribute.description: If this variable is a local, this is a link to its N_vardec. Otherwise, it is a function parameter, and this is a link to its N_arg.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.description: the inferred type, which may be more precise than DeclType.

attribute.name: DeclType
attribute.description: the declared type, iff present.

attribute.name: ConstrType
attribute.description: type constraint as imposed by the applied use of the variable, iff present.

attribute.name: ConstrVar
attribute.description: pointer to the avis of the predicat that results from the type constraint in ConstrType, iff present

attribute.name: ConstrSet
attribute.description: pointer to set of non-type constraints as imposed by the applied use of the variable, iff present

attribute.name: SSAAssign
attribute.description: provides a direct link to the N_assign node containing the definition of the identifier represented by this AVIS node. In SSA form, AVIS_SSAASSIGN must only be NULL for identifiers for function arguments and with-loop index variables.

attribute.name: NeedCount
attribute.description: xxx

attribute.name: WL_NeedCount
attribute.description: This is a count of the number of producerWL references that occur in _sel_VxA_(iv, producerWL) and _idxsel_( offset, producerWL) operations within a consumerWL.

attribute.name: Counting_WL
attribute.description: This field is the number of references to the producerWL that created this value, from one, arbitrary-chosen consumerWL. The field is used as a crude cost function on the producerWL, so that the AWLF is performed only if all references to the producerWL are from one other (consumerWL) WL.

attribute.name: BotRT
attribute.description: Used in order to memorize a replacement type for bottom funcond variables.

attribute.name: Alt
attribute.description: Used by CompareTree to remember alpha conversion

attribute.name: AliasMask
attribute.description: Used by Interface Analysis in order to obtain the transitive hull of variable aliases.

attribute.name: UniqueRef
attribute.description: First reference to this unique object declaration. Used to generate useful error messages in case of uniqueness violation.

attribute.name: Demand
attribute.description: This attribute constitutes the demand of a variable during the specializing oracle for static shape knowledge.

attribute.name: Count
attribute.description: Used to count number of times the variable is used on the lhs.

attribute.name: Lacso
attribute.description: Hidey-hole used by LACSO to link the being-scalarized array to its scalar elements. Strictly local, and could be eliminated with a bit of work.

attribute.name: Npart
attribute.description: Pointer to the N_part that defines this variable, if the variable is a WITHID_IDS or WITHID_VEC. It is used by POGO (and other polyhedral codes) to locate the N_part that defines the variable, along with its generators. It is NOT defined except within the scope of a specific traversal that descends through N_part nodes. In particular, it is set to NULL when we exit the N_part.

attribute.name: IslClass
attribute.description: Class of ISL entry. These are defined in polyhedral_defs.h.

attribute.name: IslTree
attribute.description: ISL Affine Function Tree.

attribute.name: StrideSignum
attribute.description: Signum of stride for LOOPFUN recursive call variable: 0 if unknown, 1 if positive, -1 if negative

flag.name: SSALPINV
flag.description: True denotes that this variable is loop-invariant.

flag.name: IsAlias
flag.description: Set by the Alias Analysis traversal, AVIS_ISALIAS denotes whether there can be more than one identifier for a given data object.

flag.name: IsDead
flag.description: Used to indicate which VARDECS are no longer needed and can thus be eliminated.

flag.name: IsDeadReturn
flag.description: Used to indicate a dead N_return value. This is used solely by DCI/DCR to mark return values that are not used by the external caller. We must not use AVIS_ISDEAD for this purpose, because the value may be in use elsewhere, such as for an AVIS_SHAPE.

flag.name: IsLifted
flag.description: Used by SpmdLift traversal in order to indicate which VARDECS are no longer needed and can thus be eliminated.

flag.name: IsUniqueConsumed
flag.description: Used by the uniqueness checker to determine whether a unique type has been consumed earlier on.

flag.name: IsUniqueConsumedThen
flag.description: Used by the uniqueness checker to determine whether a unique type has been consumed earlier on, before the THEN branch of an N_cond.

flag.name: IsUniqueConsumedElse
flag.description: Used by the uniqueness checker to determine whether a unique type has been consumed earlier on, before the ELSE branch of an N_cond.

flag.name: HasSAAArguments
flag.description: Within the optimisation cycle we may introduce new parameters to functions, representing shape or dimension of other parameters. If this is done for this parameter, we may set this value to TRUE.

flag.name: HasMinvalArg
flag.description: This value has its AVIS_MIN present in LACFUN calls, in the same manner as AVIS_DIM/SHAPE. This flag ensures that we do not do repeated insertions of extrema into LACFUN calls.

flag.name: HasMaxvalArg
flag.description: This value has its AVIS_MAX present in LACFUN calls, the same manner as AVIS_DIM/SHAPE. This flag ensures that we do not do repeated insertions of extrema into LACFUN calls.

flag.name: IsUsed
flag.description: Used by Loop Scalarization to determine whether a variable is used otherwise than within array position of selections. Furthermore, used by partial reuse candidate filtering to check whether a reuse candidate appears somewhere other than in selections.

flag.name: BelongingAssignmentIsNotAllowedToBeMovedUp
flag.description: This flag is used during the "Withloop Lock Optimization" process. It indicates that the belonging assignment is not allowed to be moved above the global object-lock.

flag.name: BelongingAssignmentIsNotAllowedToBeMovedDown
flag.description: This flag is used during the "Withloop Lock Optimization" process. It indicates that the belonging assignment is not allowed to be moved below the global object-lock release.

flag.name: IsThreadIndex
flag.description: If true, the given variable is the dedicated index variable for this thread function. Used by the mutc backend.

flag.name: IsMinHandled
flag.description: If true, indicates that IVEXI/IVEXP have performed whatever needs to be done to generate AVIS_MIN for this node. For N_array assignments, the extrema are not directly attached to the LHS (v), but to v' or v'', so looking for non-NULL AVIS_MIN will not work.

flag.name: IsMaxHandled
flag.description: Like IsMinHandled, but for AVIS_MAX.

flag.name: IsCudaLocal
flag.description: If true, this (array) variable should be allocated locally on CUDA.

flag.name: IsDefinedInCurrentBlock
flag.description: This flags marks AVIS nodes that are assigned in the current block. This is used in AL to separate identifiers from different blocks to confine the effect of AL to single blocks.

flag.name: IsALActive
flag.description: This flags marks AVIS nodes as potential roots of multi-operand expressions; it is used to avoid starting another go on AL for any subexpression.

flag.name: IsLoopInvariant
flag.description: This flags marks AVIS nodes as loop invariant, i.e. the variable is a parameter of a do-loop function and appears in the corresponding argument position of the recursive application.

flag.name: IsDLActive
flag.description: This flags marks AVIS nodes as active in the current context. This is used in DL to mark identifiers that are part of an expression to be simplified.

flag.name: IsOmpPrivate
flag.description: If true, the given variable is private OpenMP variable.

flag.name: IsOmpReduction
flag.description: If true, the given variable is reduction OpenMP variable used in fold.

flag.name: suballoc
flag.description: MUTC: This var is from a suballoc where the desc is passed in to this function

flag.name: DistMemSuballoc
flag.description: This variable is allocated using a suballoc. It may need to be allocated in the DSM memory.

flag.name: NeedBlocked
flag.description: If true, the given variable is a loop index and the loop needs to be blocked

flag.name: IsGenarrayMemval
flag.description: Marks genarray with-loo operatorp memval identifier. Only used in SPMD functions.

flag.name: IsModarrayMemval
flag.description: Marks modarray with-loop operator memval identifier. Only used in SPMD functions.

flag.name: IsBreakMemval
flag.description: Marks break with-loop operator memval identifier. Only used in SPMD functions.

flag.name: IsPropagateDefault
flag.description: Marks propagate with-loop operator default identifier. Only used in SPMD functions.

flag.name: FinverseSwap
flag.description: If true, the AVIS_MIN and AVIS_MAX values for this index vector have to be swapped.

flag.name: GenericMarker
flag.description: This Boolean may be used by any local traversal, as long as you promise to reset it to its default value when you are done. At present, it is used by EDFA and LFU.

flag.name: IsScalarized
flag.description: Used by LACSO to indicate that a small array argument or result has been scalarized. Its only function is to prevent us from doing the scalarization more than once.

flag.name: IsAllocLift
flag.description: This flag is set when the AVIS is created in order to lift a memory allocation out of a loop body. This is primarily set by ELMP and later the AVIS is alloc'd by LRO.

son.name: Part
son.description: Definition of one partition of a with-loop.

son.name: Code
son.description: Chain of codes associated with one or more partitions in the WL. Codes may be shared by more than one partition: each partition has an attribute, PART_CODE, that points to a WITH_CODE block.

attribute.name: Parts
attribute.description: The number of partitions in this with-loop. I have no idea what the -1 indicated. Changed to 0 since most checks look for PARTS > 0.

attribute.name: Referenced
attribute.description: The total number of RHS references to the result of this WL.

attribute.name: Referenced_Fold
attribute.description: The number of RHS references, within a potential consumerWL, to the result of this WL, by the WL at Referenced_consumerWL. WLF and AWLF can fold WLs only if this field and WITH_REFERENCED are equal. The only rationale for this restriction is that it prevents the same producerWL element from being computed more than once.

attribute.name: Referenced_consumerWL
attribute.description: The first consumerWL that refers to the result created by this putative producerWL. See Referenced_Fold.

attribute.name: SelMax
attribute.description: Maximum number of F_sel_VxA_ selections found in any of the code parts. This information is inferred by the WLSELC (WithLoopSelectionCount) traversal.

attribute.name: Access
attribute.description: A LUT containing information about the memory access patterns of relatively free arrays, for the distributed backend.

flag.name: containsFunAps
flag.description: indicates whether any partition contains an application of a user defined function. This information is inferred in the WLSELC (WithLoopSelectionCount) traversal.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.description: A pointer to the WITH_CODE block that contains the code for this partition. if present, the used counter for the code needs to be increased.

flag.name: IsCopy
flag.description: Set to true if this WL partition is a copy partition. I.e., it copies, without an index vector offset, elements of the producer-WL partition. This value is critical to optimizations that reuse memory by performing in-placed indexed assigns into a small part of a matrix. E.g., Gaussian Elimination.

flag.name: IsConsumerPart
flag.description: Set to true if this WL partition has been determined to be a consumer-WL, and a noteintersect has been attached to it. This is used by the cubeslicer to allow it to slice cubes in CUBSLpart.

son.name: Vec
son.description: This is the vector form of a WL generator. After explicit allocation (EMAL), Vec points to an N_id node.

son.name: Ids
son.description: This is the scalarized form of a WL generator. After explicit allocation (EMAL), Ids points to an N_exprs-list of N_id nodes.

son.name: Idxs
son.description: This is a chain of indices into the ravels of the results of genarray and modarray withloops. Once they are explicitly allocated in mem_alloc, they are transformed from identifier definitions (N_ids) into use sites (N_exprs of N_id).

son.name: Bound1
son.description: Bound must be an N_id or an N_array, except that, in saacyc, it must be an N_id.

son.name: Bound2
son.description: Bound must be an N_id or an N_array, except that, in saacycit must be an N_id.

son.name: GenWidth
son.description: GENWIDTH contains a vector resulting from subtracting BOUND1 from BOUND2. GENWIDTH is introduced by wlsimplification which puts the operations performing the subtraction in front of the loop. In many cases, the partial evaluation infrastructure can determine a value for GENWIDTH although the bounds are not known at compile time. Example: BOUND1 = [a], BOUND2 = [b], where b = a + [1] => GENWIDTH = [1]. GENWIDTH then serves three purposes: First, it is used by wlsimplicition to identify empty generators which can then be eliminated. Second, it is used in constant folding to propagate static index vector knowledge for one-element generators. Finally, it is used by the with-loop reuse candidate inference mechanism to identify further reuse candidates in situations where a WL A performs mainly B[iv] except in exactly one generator where B[iv+off] is selected. If off >= GENWIDTH, then B is a reuse candidate for A. All GENWIDTH annotations are removed by wrci, the remaining computations are removed by dcr.

son.name: CBlock
son.description: A possibly empty list of N_assigns that correspond to the set of expressions that appear within the curly braces that (may) follow a WL generator specification.

son.name: CExprs
son.description: A non-empty list of N_exprs that represent the expressions that create the result elements associated with each WL partition generator.

attribute.name: Used
attribute.description: Reference count - the number of PART_CODE entries that point to this code block.

flag.name: HasExtrema
flag.description: Set to true if the WITHIDs for this code block have extrema attached to them. This keeps IVEXI from attaching extrema more than once per block.

attribute.name: Size
attribute.description: The size of the array that is constructed by the with loop, or -1 if the size is not known at compile time.

attribute.name: MemId
attribute.description: Pointer to Id containing the name of the array that is constructed by the with loop.

attribute.name: Access
attribute.description: A LUT containing information about the memory access patterns of relatively free arrays, for the Distributed backend.

flag.name: HasNaiveOrdering
flag.description: True, iff the naive compilation scheme was used and thus the with-loop is not computed in canonical order.

son.name: Shape
son.description: The frame shape of the result. The WL result shape is: Shape ++ shape(Default).

son.name: Default
son.description: The default cell of the result.

son.name: RC
son.description: RC(xxx) encodes that xxx is a reuse candidate for this WL, i.e., that the result of this WL or, more specifically, the operator the RC(xxx) is attached to, can potentially be stored in xxx. This information is inferred at the end of the optimisations, IIRC but only used later on in reference counting to perform memory reuse.

son.name: PRC
son.description: PRC(xxx) encodes that xxx is a partial reuse candidate for this WL, i.e., that the result of this WL or, more specifically, the operator the PRC(xxx) is attached to, can potentially be stored in an extension of xxx. This information is inferred at the end of the optimisations, but only used later on in reference counting to perform data reuse of xxx is a prefix of the result.

son.name: ERC
son.description: Contains a list of Extra Reuse Candidates for WL memory reuse within scope.

son.name: DefShapeExpr
son.description: For with3 loops, the default element is given by genarray( DefShapeExpr, Default) where default denotes the default element of the genarray. Only present if a default element is present, as well.

son.name: RC
son.description: RC(xxx) encodes that xxx is a reuse candidate for this WL, i.e., that the result of this WL or, more specifically, the operator the RC(xxx) is attached to, can potentially be stored in xxx. This information is inferred at the end of the optimisations, IIRC but only used later on in reference counting to perform memory reuse.

son.name: ERC
son.description: Contains a list of Extra Reuse Candidates for WL memory reuse within scope.

son.name: Fn
son.description: The reduction function.

son.name: Args
son.description: Relatively free arguments to the reduction function in case of the partial application.

attribute.name: SPEXPR
attribute.description: Used in sac.y only in order to ship the WL body result into the N_code!

son.name: Initial
son.description: MUTC the value to start folding from.

attribute.name: OmpReductionOp
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the type of OpenMP reducation operator.

flag.name: IsPartialFold
flag.description: Flag to indicate if the fold performs a partial CUDA fold.

node.name: Propagate
node.description: Withloop operation for propagating objects between iterations

son.name: IdxInf
son.description: Gives the infimum of all indices in the iteration space of this segment. Note that for static segments (ISDYNAMIC == FALSE), this must be an array of integer constants.

son.name: IdxSup
son.description: Gives the supremum of all indices in the iteration space of this segment. Note that for non-dynamic segments (ISDYNAMIC == FALSE), this must be an array of integer constants.

son.name: UBV
son.description: This son is only present if the segment is static (ISDYNAMIC == FALSE). The length of the vector is replicated by the BLOCKS attribute.

son.name: BV
son.description: This son contains an N_exprs chain of integer vectors encoded as N_array nodes. The number of expressions in the chain needs to be equal to the BLOCKS attribute. Each vector, in turn, needs to have exactly DIMS many elements.

son.name: SV
son.description: This son is only present if the segment is static (ISDYNAMIC == FALSE). The length of the vector is replicated by the BLOCKS attribute.

son.name: HomSV
son.description: This son is only present if the segment is static (ISDYNAMIC == FALSE). The length of the vector is replicated by the BLOCKS attribute.

attribute.name: Dims
attribute.description: Gives the number of dimensions of this segment, i.e., the rank of the computed result.

flag.name: IsDynamic
flag.description: Signals that this segment has bounds that are not statically known.

son.name: Bound1
son.description: Gives the lower bound of this stride. This needs to be an N_num if ISDYNAMIC is not set.

son.name: Bound2
son.description: Gives the lower bound of this stride. This needs to be an N_num if ISDYNAMIC is not set.

son.name: Step
son.description: Gives the step of this stride. This needs to be an N_num if ISDYNAMIC is not set.

flag.name: IsModified
flag.description: Used in wltransform.

flag.name: IsDynamic
flag.description: Signals that this stride has bounds or a step that are not statically known.

son.name: Bound1
son.description: Encodes the lower bound of the grid. This needs to be a N_num node if ISDYNAMIC is not set.

son.name: Bound2
son.description: Encodes the upper bound of the grid. This needs to be a N_num node if ISDYNAMIC is not set.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.description: if present, the used counter for the code needs to be increased

flag.name: IsModified
flag.description: Used in wltransform.

flag.name: IsDynamic
flag.description: Signals that this grid has bounds that are not statically known.

flag.name: Used
flag.description: Used to flag those symbols that are in fact used, that is, those that do exist in the module.

flag.name: IsArtificial
flag.description: Set to true if the given return value was introduced when resolving reference arguments and thus will be removed again later on. Set to false for all other return values.

node.name: Nums
node.description: Linked list of Integers, used only in scanner/parser

flag.name: IsSpawned
flag.description: This function is spawned when using functional parallelism

flag.name: IsRemote
flag.description: This function call should be spawned on another resource

flag.name: IsXtBundle
flag.description: Used to tack a funbundle as an XT version of another bundler

flag.name: IsStBundle
flag.description: Used to tack a funbundle as an ST version of another bundler

node.name: With3
node.description: Used to model the 1d with-loop used by the mutc backend. The with3 loop is nested to provide the needed number of detentions

son.name: Ranges
son.description: Gives the set of ranges (generators) this with-loop is defined for. Needs to be a full partition of the outer-most dimension of the result.

son.name: Operations
son.description: The operations this with-loop computes.

flag.name: UseConcurrentRanges
flag.description: Controls whether the ranges of a with3 will be computed concurrently, or whether the ranges are sequentialised

flag.name: Dense
flag.description: This with3 covers all of the index space without gaps

flag.name: IsTopLevel
flag.description: This with3 represents a top-level stride of a former with2. This is used to indetify into what array the IIRR (see N_range) indexes.

son.name: Index
son.description: Scalar index of this range.

son.name: LowerBound
son.description: Lower bound of this range.

son.name: UpperBound
son.description: Upper bound of this range.

son.name: ChunkSize
son.description: Chunk size of this range. If non-NULL, this range is not computed by computing each cell alone, but by computing vectors of ChunkSize many elements per iteration. Note that the total number of elements computed by this range needs to be a multiple of ChunkSize! If the range is 0 then the chunk must be 1!

son.name: Body
son.description: Block computed for each iteration.

son.name: Results
son.description: Values assigned to the result for each iteration.

son.name: Idxs
son.description: This is a chain of indices into the ravels of the results of genarray and modarray withloops. Once they are explicitly used in mem_alloc and mem_dr, this special reference is freed.

son.name: IIRR
son.description: This is a chain of indices into the ravel of the overall result of genarray/modarray withloops. It corresponds (value-wise) to the wlidx of the origininal with2 and is used in optimisations like data-reuse to identify selections into the reused array. This chain only exists for the ranges of the innermost with3 of a transformed with2, as it is only defined in that level.

attribute.name: BlockSize
attribute.description: Used for resource allocation. Corresponds to the blocksize argument of the create instruction in mutc.

attribute.name: G2SInstrs
attribute.description: Used for temporarily storing global to shared memory data load instructions.

flag.name: IsGlobal
flag.description: True iff this range should be distributed globally over multiple cores

flag.name: IsBlocked
flag.description: True iff this range is blocked by the blocking pragma

flag.name: IsFitting
flag.description: True iff this range is a fitting range

flag.name: NeedCudaUnroll
flag.description: True iff this range needs to be unrolled by the CUDA compiler

node.name: Idag
node.description: Node to represent infinite graphs as needed for the subtyping relation of the array shape type component

node.name: IdagVFam
node.description: represents the head entry of a vertex family chain

node.name: IdagEFam
node.description: represents the head entry of a edge family chain

node.name: IdagVertices
node.description: a simple chain of links to vertices

node.name: IdagEFams
node.description: a simple chain of links to edge family entries

node.name: Withs
node.description: a simple chain of with-loops, used by distributed backend to support different transformations of with-loop code for each target architecture.
